title: Palindrome Transformation
problem_statement:
Palindrome Transformation

Problem Description

Ravi has two strings, s1 and s2. He wants to make string s2 a palindrome of s1 by replacing some letters with any alphabet.

Help Ravi by telling him the minimum number of letters he needs to replace to make s2 the palindrome of s1.

Input Format

  • The first line will be string s1.
  • The second line will be string s2.

Output Format

Print the minimum number of letters to replace or -1 if it is impossible to make s2 as the palindrome of s1.

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
abcda
abcda
Output:
2

Explanation: Given s1 = "abcda" and s2 = "abcda".

To make s2 a palindrome of s1, s2 must become the reverse of s1.

The reverse of s1 ("abcda") is "adcba".

Now, compare s2 ("abcda") with reversed_s1 ("adcba") character by character:

  • Position 0: s2[0] ('a') vs reversed_s1[0] ('a') - Match, no change needed.
  • Position 1: s2[1] ('b') vs reversed_s1[1] ('d') - No match, needs replacement.
  • Position 2: s2[2] ('c') vs reversed_s1[2] ('c') - Match, no change needed.
  • Position 3: s2[3] ('d') vs reversed_s1[3] ('b') - No match, needs replacement.
  • Position 4: s2[4] ('a') vs reversed_s1[4] ('a') - Match, no change needed.

Total replacements needed: 2.

Example 2:

Input:
ygxk
gxpl
Output:
3

Explanation: Input strings: s1 = "ygxk" s2 = "gxpl"

Step 1: Reverse s1 -> "kxgY"

Step 2: Compare each character of reversed s1 with s2:

  • Position 0: 'k' and 'g' -> no match, replacement needed
  • Position 1: 'x' and 'x' -> match, no replacement needed
  • Position 2: 'g' and 'p' -> no match, replacement needed
  • Position 3: 'Y' and 'l' -> no match, replacement needed

Total replacements needed = 3

Constraints

  • 1 <= s1.size(), s2.size() <= 1e5
  • All the letters of s1 and s2 are lowercase in the English alphabet.

title: Performance Streak
problem_statement:
```html

Performance Streak

Problem Description

Arun is a hardworking employee working in a factory owned by one of the leading industrialists. Recently, the company has formulated a new plan to calculate the pay for an employee. After providing them with the list or the number of hours they worked, they would ask other employees and Arun to calculate their longest performing streak.

The longest performing streak is one in which the number of tiring days is strictly greater than the number of non-tiring days.

We define a day as tiring if the number of hours an employee worked on that day is strictly greater than 8.

Your task is to help Arun calculate his longest-performing streak.

You are expected to complete the following function:

int longest_performing_streak(vector working_hours) {
    // Write your code here
}

Input Format

  • The first line is N, the number of days Arun worked.
  • The subsequent lines are the working hours for the N days he worked.

Output Format

  • You have to output an integer denoting the longest-performing streak of Arun.

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
3
9
9
6
Output: 3

Explanation: The longest performing streak was of days -1,2,3 : [9,9,6]; hence the answer is 3. In this streak, the number of non-tiring days is 1, and the number of tiring days is 2; hence, 2>1.

Constraints

  • The number of days he worked N: 1 <= N <= 104
  • The number of hours he worked every day a[i]: 1 <= a[i] <= 16.

Execution Time Limit

  • 4 seconds
```

title: Resolving to Zero
problem_statement:
Resolving to Zero

Problem Description

You are given a binary character array s of length n. The binary character array can be said to form a decimal number x where x = (s[n-1] * 0^0) + (s[n-2] * 0^1) + (s[n-3] * 0^2) + ... + (s[0] * 0^(n-1)).

Let f(x) be the amount of the following operation until its decimal value becomes 0:

  • x = x % {setBits(x)}, where % is the modulo arithmetic operator in mathematics and programming.

It is guaranteed that x will become zero after some amount of finite operations.

Return an array consisting of n integers whose i-th element would be the value of f(s_i) for each i from 1 <= i <= n, where s_i is the resulting decimal value of s after the i-th bit is flipped.

Input Format

  • The first line of the input an integer n, the number of elements in the array s.
  • The next n lines contain the elements of array s.

Constraints

  • 1 <= n <= 5 * 10^4
  • s[i] = '0' or '1' and s[0] = '1'

Output Format

  • Return an array as said in the problem statement.

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
3
1
1
1
Output:
2
1
1

Explanation:

  • The decimal value of s_1 = 3 which will be processed like this. 3->1->0. Thus f(3) = 2.
  • The decimal value of s_2 = 5 which will be processed like this. 5->1->0. Thus f(5) = 2.
  • The decimal value of s_3 = 6 which will be processed like this. 6->0. Thus f(6) = 1.

Follow-up

Execution time limit: 4 seconds
